info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 28 at 4:16AM EDT by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...A NARROW BAND OF SNOW WILL AFFECT PARTS OF NORTHERN FAIRFIELD...NORTHERN NEW HAVEN...AND SOUTHERN NEW HAVEN COUNTIES... HAZARDS...A narrow band of snow accompanied by winds of up to 35 MPH which can rapidly reduce visibility to less than one mile. A quick dusting to half inch of snow is possible in this band. LOCATION AND MOVEMENT...At 411 AM EDT, a northwest to southeast oriented narrow band of snow was nearly stationary across New Haven. This band may drift slowly south over the next hour and a half. LOCATIONS IMPACTED INCLUDE... New Haven, Waterbury, Danbury, Milford, Shelton, Naugatuck, Guilford, Southbury, Sherman, Newtown, Hamden, Stratford, Trumbull, Cheshire and Branford. SAFETY INFO... Conditions can deteriorate rapidly in winter weather situations. Be prepared for snow covered roads. Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. &&
